   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_REG:         include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_MON:         include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL:       include
   29: %%         ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE:  include
   30: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS:     include
   31: %%
   32: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   33: %%
   34: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   38: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   39: %%
   40: %% Run a specific group:
   41: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   42: %%
   43: %% Run a specific test case:
   44: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   45: %%
   46: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   47: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   48: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   50: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   51: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   54: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   55: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   59: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   60: %%
   61: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   62: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   63: 
   64: 
   65: 
   66: -module(socket_SUITE).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   69: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   70: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   71: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   72: 
   73: %% Suite exports
   74: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   75: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   76:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   77:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   78:

  183: 
  184: suite() ->
  185:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  186:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  187: 
  188: all() -> 
  189:     Groups = [{reg,          "ESOCK_TEST_REG",        include},
  190:               {monitor,      "ESOCK_TEST_MON",        include},
  191:               {ioctl,        "ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL",      include},
  192: 	      {socket_close, "ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE", include},
  193: 	      {tickets,      "ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS",    include}],
  194:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  195: 
  196: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  197:     [];
  198: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  199:     [{group, Group}];
  200: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  201: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  202: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  203: 		[{group, Group}];
  204: 	    false ->
  205: 		[];
  206: 	    Val ->
  207: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  208: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  209: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  210: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  211: 			[{group, Group}];
  212: 		    _ ->
  213: 			[]
  214: 		end
  215: 	end.
  216:     
  217: 
  218: groups() -> 
  219:     [{reg,                         [], reg_simple_cases()},
  220: 
  221:      {monitor,                     [], monitor_cases()},
  222: 
  223:      {socket_close,                [], socket_close_cases()},
  224:      {sc_ctrl_proc_exit,           [], sc_cp_exit_cases()},
  225:      {sc_local_close,              [], sc_lc_cases()},
  226:      {sc_remote_close,             [], sc_rc_cases()},
  227:      {sc_remote_shutdown,          [], sc_rs_cases()},
  228: 
  229:      {ioctl,                       [], ioctl_cases()},
  230:      {ioctl_simple,                [], ioctl_simple_cases()},
  231:      {ioctl_get,                   [], ioctl_get_cases()},
  232:      {ioctl_set,                   [], ioctl_set_cases()},
  233: 
  234:      %% Ticket groups
  235:      {tickets,                     [], tickets_cases()},
  236:      {otp16359,                    [], otp16359_cases()},
  237:      {otp18240,                    [], otp18240_cases()}
  238:     ].
  239:

  400: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  401:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  402:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  403:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  404:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  405:     
  406:     try socket:info() of
  407:         #{} ->
  408:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  409:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  410:                     SKIP;
  411: 
  412:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  413: 
  414:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  415:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  416: 
  417:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  418:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  419: 
  420:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  421:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  422:                         default ->
  423:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  424:                                 ok ->
  425:                                     Config1;
  426:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  427:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  428:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  429:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  430:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  431:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  432:                             end;
  433:                         Quiet ->
  434:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  435:                                 ok ->
  436:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  437:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  438:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  439:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  440:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  441:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  442:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  443:                             end
  444:                     end
  445:             end
  446:     catch
  447:         error : notsup ->
  448:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  449:         error : undef ->
  450:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  451:     end.
  452: 
  453: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  454: 
  455:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  456:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  457:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  458: 
  459:     %% Stop the local monitor
  460:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  461: 
  462:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  463: 
  464:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  465: 
  466:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  467:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  468: 
  469:     Config1.
  470: 
  471: 
  472: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  473:   when (GroupName =:= sc_remote_close) orelse
  474:        (GroupName =:= sc_remote_shutdown) ->
  475:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  476:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  477:               "~n", [GroupName, Config]),
  478:     %% Maybe we should skip the entire suite for this platform,
  479:     %% but for now we just skip these groups, which seem to 
  480:     %% have problems (node start).
  481:     %% As stated elsewhere, its not really Fedora 16, but 
  482:     %% the *really* slow VM that is the issue.
  483:     try is_old_fedora16() of
  484:         ok ->
  485:             Config
  486:     catch
  487:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  488:             SKIP
  489:     end;
  490: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  491:   when (GroupName =:= ioctl) ->
  492:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  493:               "~n   Config:"
  494:               "~n      ~p"
  495:               "~nwhen"
  496:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Requests: "
  497:               "~n~s"
  498:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Flags: "
  499:               "~n~s"
  500:               "~n", [GroupName, Config,
  501:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_requests), 6),
  502:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_flags), 6)]),
  503:     Config;
  504: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  505:     Config.
  506: 
  507: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  508:     Config.
  509: 
  510: format_ioctls(Reqs, PrefixSz) ->
  511:     Max = format_ioctls_max(Reqs),
  512:     format_ioctls(Reqs, string:pad("", PrefixSz), Max).
  513: 
  514: format_ioctls_max(Reqs) ->
  515:     format_ioctls_max(Reqs, 0).
  516: 
  517: format_ioctls_max([], Max) ->
  518:     Max;
  519: format_ioctls_max([{Req, _}|Reqs], Max) when is_atom(Req) ->
  520:     ReqStr = atom_to_list(Req),
  521:     case length(ReqStr)+1 of
  522:         NewMax when (NewMax > Max) ->
  523:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, NewMax);
  524:         _ ->
  525:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, Max)
  526:     end.
  527: 
  528: format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max) ->
  529:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max, []).
  530: 
  531: format_ioctls([], _Prefix, _Max, Acc) ->
  532:     lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Acc));
  533: format_ioctls([{Key, Sup}|IOCtls], Prefix, Max, Acc) ->
  534:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max,
  535:                   [format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) | Acc]).
  536: 
  537: format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) ->
  538:     KeyStr  = io_lib:format("~w:", [Key]),
  539:     KeyStr2 = lists:flatten(string:pad(KeyStr, Max, trailing, " ")),
  540:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s~s ~w~n", [Prefix, KeyStr2, Sup])).
  541: 
  542: 
  543: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  544:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  545:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  546:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  547:     Config.
  548: 
  549: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  550:     Config.
  551: 
  552: 
  553: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  554:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  555:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  556:             Quiet;
  557:         false ->
  558:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  559:                 "true"  -> true;
  560:                 "false" -> false;
  561:                 _       -> default
  562:             end
  563:     end.
  564: 
  565:

  567: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  568: %%                                                                     %%
  569: %%                             REGISTRY                                %%
  570: %%                                                                     %%
  571: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  572: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  573: 
  574: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  575: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  576: %% has the correct info.
  577: 
  578: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  579:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  580:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
  581:            fun() ->
  582:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
  583:            end).
  584: 
  585: 
  586: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  587:     socket:use_registry(true),
  588: 
  589:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
  590: 
  591:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
  592:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
  593:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
  594:     N = length(Existing),
  595:     SupportsIPV6 =
  596:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
  597:             ok ->
  598:                 true;
  599:             _ ->
  600:                 false
  601:         end,
  602:     SupportsLOCAL =
  603:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
  604:             ok ->
  605:                 true;
  606:             _ ->
  607:                 false
  608:         end,
  609:     SupportsSCTP =
  610:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
  611:             ok ->
  612:                 true;
  613:             _ ->
  614:                 false
  615:         end,
  616:     InitSockInfos =
  617:         [
  618:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  619:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  620:         ] ++
  621:         case SupportsIPV6 of
  622:             true ->
  623:                 [
  624:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
  625:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
  626:                 ];
  627:             false ->
  628:                 []
  629:         end ++
  630:         case SupportsLOCAL of
  631:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
  632:                 [
  633:                  {local, stream, default},
  634:                  {local, dgram,  default}
  635:                 ];
  636:             true ->
  637:                 [
  638:                  {local, stream, default}
  639:                 ];
  640:             false ->
  641:                 []
  642:         end ++
  643:         [
  644:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  645:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  646:         ] ++
  647:         case SupportsSCTP of
  648:             true ->
  649:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  650:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  651:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  652:                 case socket:open(inet,
  653:                                  seqpacket,
  654:                                  sctp,
  655:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  656:                     {ok, S} ->
  657:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  658:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
  659:                         [
  660:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
  661:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
  662:                         ];
  663:                     {error, _} ->
  664:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  665:                         []
  666:                 end;
  667:             false ->
  668:                 []
  669:         end ++
  670:         [
  671:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  672:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  673:         ] ++
  674:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
  675:             true ->
  676:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  677:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  678:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  679:                 case socket:open(inet6,
  680:                                  seqpacket,
  681:                                  sctp,
  682:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  683:                     {ok, S6} ->
  684:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  685:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
  686:                         [
  687:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
  688:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
  689:                         ];
  690:                     {error, _} ->
  691:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  692:                         []
  693:                 end;
  694:             false ->
  695:                 []
  696:         end,
  697: 
  698:     i("open sockets"),
  699:     Socks =
  700:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
  701:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
  702:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
  703:                  Sock
  704:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
  705: 
  706:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  707: 
  708: 
  709:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
  710: 
  711:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
  712:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
  713: 
  714:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
  715:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
  716:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
  717:         true ->
  718:             ok;
  719:         false ->
  720:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
  721:     end,
  722: 
  723: 
  724:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
  725: 
  726:     %% inet, stream, tcp
  727:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
  728:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
  729: 
  730:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
  731:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
  732:         true ->
  733:             ok;
  734:         false ->
  735:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
  736:     end,
  737: 
  738: 
  739:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
  740: 
  741:     %% inet, dgram, udp
  742:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
  743:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
  744: 
  745:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
  746:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
  747:         true ->
  748:             ok;
  749:         false ->
  750:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
  751:     end,
  752: 
  753: 
  754:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
  755: 
  756:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
  757:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  758:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  759: 
  760:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
  761:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
  762:         true ->
  763:             ok;
  764:         false ->
  765:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
  766:     end,
  767: 
  768: 
  769:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
  770: 
  771:     %% inet
  772:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
  773:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
  774: 
  775:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
  776:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
  777:         true ->
  778:             ok;
  779:         false ->
  780:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
  781:     end,
  782: 
  783: 
  784:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
  785: 
  786:     %% inet6
  787:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
  788:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
  789: 
  790:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
  791:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
  792:         true ->
  793:             ok;
  794:         false ->
  795:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
  796:     end,
  797: 
  798: 
  799:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
  800: 
  801:     %% local
  802:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
  803:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
  804: 
  805:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
  806:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
  807:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
  808:         true ->
  809:             ok;
  810:         false ->
  811:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
  812:     end,
  813: 
  814: 
  815:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
  816: 
  817:     i("close sockets"),
  818:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  819:                           i("close socket"),                          
  820:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  821:                   end, Socks),
  822: 
  823:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  824: 
  825:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  826: 
  827:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
  828:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
  829:         true ->
  830:             ok;
  831:         false ->
  832:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
  833:     end,
  834: 
  835: 
  836:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
  837:     Expected1 = [],
  838:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
  839:         Expected1 ->
  840:             ok;
  841:         Unexpected1 ->
  842:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
  843:     end,
  844: 
  845:     i("create some sockets", []),
  846:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
  847:                    [fun({D, T})->
  848:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
  849:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
  850:                             OSocks
  851:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
  852:                                          [{inet, dgram},
  853:                                           {inet, dgram},
  854:                                           {inet, stream},
  855:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
  856: 
  857:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
  858:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
  859:         OwnSockets ->
  860:             ok;
  861:         Unexpected2 ->
  862:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
  863:     end,
  864: 
  865:     i("close (own) sockets"),
  866:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  867:                           i("close socket"),                          
  868:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  869:                   end, OwnSockets),
  870:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  871: 
  872:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
  873:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  874: 
  875:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
  876:     case socket:which_sockets() of
  877:         Existing ->
  878:             ok;
  879:         OtherSockets ->
  880:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
  881:     end,
  882: 
  883:     socket:use_registry(false),
  884:     ok.
  885: 
  886: 
  887: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
  888:     socket:use_registry(false),
  889:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
  890: 
  891: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
  892:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
  893:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  894: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
  895:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  896:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
  897: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
  898:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  899:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
  900: 
  901: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  902:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
  903:            (_) -> false
  904:         end,
  905:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  906: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
  907:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
  908:            (_) -> false
  909:         end,
  910:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  911: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
  912:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
  913:            (_) -> false
  914:         end,
  915:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  916: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  917:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  918:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
  919:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
  920:                 true;
  921:            (_) ->
  922:                 false
  923:         end,
  924:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
  925: 
  926: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
  927:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
  928: 
  929: 
  930: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  931:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
  932:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
  933: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  934:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
  935:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  936: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
  937:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  938:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
  939: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
  940:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  941:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
  942: 
  943: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  944:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
  945:                 true;
  946:            (_X) ->
  947:                 false
  948:         end,
  949:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
  950: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  951:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
  952:               type     := T,
  953:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  954:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
  955:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
  956:                 true;
  957:            (_X) ->
  958:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
  959:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
  960:                 false
  961:         end,
  962:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
  963: 
  964: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
  965:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
  966: 
  967: 
  968: 
  969: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  970: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  971: %% has the correct info.
  972: 
  973: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  974:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  975:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
  976:            fun() ->
  977:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
  978:            end).
  979: 
  980: 
  981: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  982:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
  983:     socket:use_registry(true),
  984:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
  985: 
  986:     i("get current socket base count"),
  987:     Base = socket:number_of(),
  988: 
  989:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
  990:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  991:     Base1 = Base + 1,
  992:     case socket:number_of() of
  993:         Base1 ->
  994:             ok;
  995:         Invalid1 -> 
  996:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
  997:     end,
  998:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
  999:     ok = socket:close(S1),
 1000:     case socket:number_of() of
 1001:         Base ->
 1002:             ok;
 1003:         Invalid2 -> 
 1004:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
 1005:     end,
 1006: 
 1007:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
 1008:       "and ensure its not counted"),
 1009:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
 1010:     case socket:number_of() of
 1011:         Base ->
 1012:             ok;
 1013:         Invalid3 -> 
 1014:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
 1015:     end,
 1016:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1017:     ok = socket:close(S2),
 1018:     case socket:number_of() of
 1019:         Base ->
 1020:             ok;
 1021:         Invalid4 -> 
 1022:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
 1023:     end,
 1024: 
 1025:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
 1026:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1027:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
 1028:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1029:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
 1030:     case socket:number_of() of
 1031:         Base ->
 1032:             ok;
 1033:         Invalid5 -> 
 1034:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
 1035:     end,
 1036:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1037:     ok = socket:close(S3),
 1038:     case socket:number_of() of
 1039:         Base ->
 1040:             ok;
 1041:         Invalid6 -> 
 1042:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
 1043:     end,
 1044: 
 1045:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
 1046:       "and ensure its counted"),
 1047:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
 1048:     case socket:number_of() of
 1049:         Base1 ->
 1050:             ok;
 1051:         Invalid7 -> 
 1052:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
 1053:     end,
 1054:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
 1055:     ok = socket:close(S4),
 1056:     case socket:number_of() of
 1057:         Base ->
 1058:             ok;
 1059:         Invalid8 -> 
 1060:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
 1061:     end,
 1062: 
 1063:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1064:     i("done"),
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: 
 1068: 
 1069: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1070: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1071: %%                                                                     %%
 1072: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
 1073: %%                                                                     %%
 1074: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1075: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1076: 
 1077: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1078: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
 1079: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1080: 
 1081: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1082:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1083:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
 1084:            fun() ->
 1085: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1086:                                  type     => stream,
 1087:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1088:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
 1089:            end).
 1090: 
 1091: 
 1092: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
 1093:     OwnerSeq =
 1094:         [
 1095:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1096:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1097:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1098:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1099:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1100:                    end},
 1101:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1102:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1103:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1104:                            ok
 1105:                    end},
 1106: 
 1107:          %% *** Init part ***
 1108:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1109:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1110:                          type     := Type, 
 1111:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1112:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1113:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1114:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1115:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1116:                                    ERROR
 1117:                            end
 1118:                    end},
 1119:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1120:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1121:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1122:                            ok
 1123:                    end},
 1124: 
 1125:          %% The actual test
 1126:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1127:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1128:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1129:                    end},
 1130: 
 1131:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1132:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1133:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1134: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1135:                    end},
 1136: 
 1137:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1138:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1139:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1140:                                ok ->
 1141:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1142:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1143:                                    ERROR
 1144:                            end
 1145:                    end},
 1146: 
 1147:          %% *** We are done ***
 1148:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1149:         ],
 1150: 
 1151:     TesterSeq =
 1152:         [
 1153:          %% *** Init part ***
 1154:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1155:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1156:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1157:                            ok
 1158:                    end},
 1159:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1160:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1161:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1162:                            ok
 1163:                    end},
 1164:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1165:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1166:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1167:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1168:                    end},
 1169:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1170:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1171: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1172: 			   ok
 1173:                    end},
 1174:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1175:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1176: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1177: 			   ok
 1178:                    end},
 1179:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
 1180:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1181:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1182:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1183: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
 1184: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 1185: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
 1186: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
 1187:                    end},
 1188:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 1189:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1190: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1191: 			   ok
 1192:                    end},
 1193:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 1194:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1195: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1196: 			   ok
 1197:                    end},
 1198:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
 1199:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
 1200: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1201: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1202: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
 1203: 			       Mons ->
 1204: 				   ok;
 1205: 			       SMons ->
 1206: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
 1207: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1208: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1209: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1210: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1211: 			   end
 1212:                    end},
 1213:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
 1214:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1215: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
 1216: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1217: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1218: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
 1219: 			       Mons ->
 1220: 				   ok;
 1221: 			       SMons ->
 1222: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
 1223: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1224: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1225: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1226: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1227: 			   end
 1228:                    end},
 1229:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1230:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1231: 			   Self   = self(),
 1232: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1233: 			   ok
 1234:                    end},
 1235: 
 1236:          %% The actual test
 1237:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1238:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1239:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1240:                            ok
 1241:                    end},
 1242:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
 1243:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1244: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
 1245: 			   receive
 1246: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1247: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1248: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1249: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1250: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1251: 					       [MRef,
 1252: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1253: 						Info]),
 1254: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
 1255: 			   after 5000 ->
 1256: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1257: 				   {error, timeout}
 1258: 			   end
 1259:                    end},
 1260:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
 1261:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1262: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 1263: 			   receive
 1264: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1265: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1266: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1267: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1268: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1269: 					       [MRef,
 1270: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1271: 						Info]),
 1272: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
 1273: 			   after 5000 ->
 1274: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1275: 				   {error, timeout}
 1276: 			   end
 1277:                    end},
 1278:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1279:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1280: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1281: 			   ok
 1282:                    end},
 1283:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1284:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1285: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1286: 			   ok
 1287:                    end},
 1288:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1289:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1290: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1291: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1292: 			   ok
 1293:                    end},
 1294:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1295:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1296: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1297: 			   ok
 1298:                    end},
 1299: 
 1300:          %% Cleanup
 1301:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1302:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1303:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1304:                            ok
 1305:                    end},
 1306: 
 1307:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1308:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1309:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1310:                                ok ->
 1311:                                    ok;
 1312:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1313:                                    ERROR
 1314:                            end
 1315:                    end},
 1316: 
 1317:          %% *** We are done ***
 1318:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1319:         ],
 1320: 
 1321:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1322:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1323: 
 1324:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1325:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1326:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1327: 
 1328:     i("await evaluator"),
 1329:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1330: 
 1331: 
 1332: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1333: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
 1334: %% owner process.
 1335: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1336: 
 1337: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1338:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1339:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
 1340:            fun() ->
 1341: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1342:                                  type     => stream,
 1343:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1344:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
 1345:            end).
 1346: 
 1347: 
 1348: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
 1349:     OwnerSeq =
 1350:         [
 1351:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1352:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1353:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1354:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1355:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1356:                    end},
 1357:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1358:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1359:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1360:                            ok
 1361:                    end},
 1362: 
 1363:          %% *** Init part ***
 1364:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1365:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1366:                          type     := Type, 
 1367:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1368:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1369:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1370:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1371:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1372:                                    ERROR
 1373:                            end
 1374:                    end},
 1375:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1377:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1378:                            ok
 1379:                    end},
 1380: 
 1381:          %% The actual test
 1382:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1383:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1384:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1385:                                ok ->
 1386:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1387:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1388:                                    ERROR
 1389:                            end
 1390:                    end},
 1391: 
 1392:          %% *** We are done ***
 1393:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1394:         ],
 1395: 
 1396:     TesterSeq =
 1397:         [
 1398:          %% *** Init part ***
 1399:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1400:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1401:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1402:                            ok
 1403:                    end},
 1404:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1405:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1406:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1407:                            ok
 1408:                    end},
 1409:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1410:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1411:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1412:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1413:                    end},
 1414:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1415:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1416: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1417: 			   ok
 1418:                    end},
 1419:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1420:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1421: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1422: 			   ok
 1423:                    end},
 1424:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1425:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1426:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1427: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1428: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1429:                    end},
 1430:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1431:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1432: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1433: 			   ok
 1434:                    end},
 1435:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1436:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1437: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1438: 			   ok
 1439:                    end},
 1440:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1441:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1442: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1443: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1444: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1445: 			   ok
 1446:                    end},
 1447:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1448:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1449: 			   Self   = self(),
 1450: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1451: 			   ok
 1452:                    end},
 1453: 
 1454:          %% The actual test
 1455:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1456:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1457:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1458:                            ok
 1459:                    end},
 1460:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1461:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1462:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1463:                                ok ->
 1464:                                    ok;
 1465:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1466:                                    ERROR
 1467:                            end
 1468:                    end},
 1469: 
 1470:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1471:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1472: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1473: 			   receive
 1474: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1475: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1476: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1477: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1478: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1479: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1480: 				   ok
 1481: 			   after 5000 ->
 1482: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1483: 				   {error, timeout}
 1484: 			   end
 1485:                    end},
 1486:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1487:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1488: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1489: 			   ok
 1490:                    end},
 1491:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1492:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1493: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1494: 			   ok
 1495:                    end},
 1496:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1497:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1498: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1499: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1500: 			   ok
 1501:                    end},
 1502:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1503:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1504: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1505: 			   ok
 1506:                    end},
 1507: 
 1508:          %% *** We are done ***
 1509:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1510:         ],
 1511: 
 1512:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1513:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1514: 
 1515:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1516:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1517:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1518: 
 1519:     i("await evaluator"),
 1520:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).

 1523: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1524: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
 1525: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
 1526: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
 1527: 
 1528: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1529:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1530:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
 1531:            fun() ->
 1532: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1533:                                  type     => stream,
 1534:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1535:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
 1536:            end).
 1537: 
 1538: 
 1539: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
 1540:     OwnerSeq =
 1541:         [
 1542:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1543:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1544:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1545:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1546:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1547:                    end},
 1548:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1549:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1550:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1551:                            ok
 1552:                    end},
 1553: 
 1554:          %% *** Init part ***
 1555:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1556:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1557:                          type     := Type, 
 1558:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1559:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1560:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1561:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1562:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1563:                                    ERROR
 1564:                            end
 1565:                    end},
 1566:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1567:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1568:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1569:                            ok
 1570:                    end},
 1571: 
 1572:          %% The actual test
 1573:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1574:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1575:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1576:                    end},
 1577: 
 1578:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1579:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1580:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1581: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1582:                    end},
 1583: 
 1584:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1585:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1586:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1587:                                ok ->
 1588:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1589:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1590:                                    ERROR
 1591:                            end
 1592:                    end},
 1593: 
 1594:          %% *** We are done ***
 1595:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1596:         ],
 1597: 
 1598:     TesterSeq =
 1599:         [
 1600:          %% *** Init part ***
 1601:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1602:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1603:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1604:                            ok
 1605:                    end},
 1606:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1607:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1608:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1609:                            ok
 1610:                    end},
 1611:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1612:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1613:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1614:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1615:                    end},
 1616:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1617:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1618: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1619: 			   ok
 1620:                    end},
 1621:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1622:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1623: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1624: 			   ok
 1625:                    end},
 1626:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1627:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1628:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1629: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1630: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1631:                    end},
 1632:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1633:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1634: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1635: 			   ok
 1636:                    end},
 1637:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1638:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1639: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1640: 			   ok
 1641:                    end},
 1642: 
 1643:          %% The actual test
 1644:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
 1645:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
 1646:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 1647: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
 1648:                    end},
 1649: 
 1650: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1651: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1652: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1653: 			   ok
 1654: 		   end},
 1655: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1656: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1657: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1658: 			   ok
 1659: 		   end},
 1660: 
 1661:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1662:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1663:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1664:                            ok
 1665:                    end},
 1666: 
 1667:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1668:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1669: 			   receive
 1670: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1671: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
 1672: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1673: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1674: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1675: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1676: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
 1677: 			   after 5000 ->
 1678: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
 1679: 				   ok
 1680: 			   end
 1681:                    end},
 1682: 
 1683:          %% Cleanup
 1684:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1685:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1686:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1687:                            ok
 1688:                    end},
 1689: 
 1690:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1691:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1692:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1693:                                ok ->
 1694:                                    ok;
 1695:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1696:                                    ERROR
 1697:                            end
 1698:                    end},
 1699: 
 1700:          %% *** We are done ***
 1701:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1702:         ],
 1703: 
 1704:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1705:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1706: 
 1707:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1708:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1709:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1710: 
 1711:     i("await evaluator"),
 1712:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1713:

 1715: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1716: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
 1717: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1718: 
 1719: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1720:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1721:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
 1722:            fun() ->
 1723: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1724:                                  type     => stream,
 1725:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1726:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 1727:            end).
 1728: 
 1729: 
 1730: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 1731:     OwnerSeq =
 1732:         [
 1733:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1734:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1735:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1736:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1737:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1738:                    end},

 2155: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2156: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then exit
 2157: %% the owner process.
 2158: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2159: 
 2160: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2161:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2162:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks,
 2163:            fun() ->
 2164: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2165:                                  type     => stream,
 2166:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2167:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState)
 2168:            end).
 2169: 
 2170: 
 2171: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2172:     OwnerSeq =
 2173:         [
 2174:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2175:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2176:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2177:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2178:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2179:                    end},
 2180:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2181:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2182:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2183:                            ok
 2184:                    end},
 2185: 
 2186:          %% *** Init part ***
 2187:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2188:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2189:                          type     := Type, 
 2190:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2191:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2192:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2193:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2194:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2195:                                    ERROR
 2196:                            end
 2197:                    end},
 2198:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2199:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2200:                          type     := Type, 
 2201:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2202:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2203:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2204:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2205:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2206:                                    ERROR
 2207:                            end
 2208:                    end},
 2209:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2210:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2211:                          type     := Type, 
 2212:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2213:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2214:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2215:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2216:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2217:                                    ERROR
 2218:                            end
 2219:                    end},
 2220:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2221:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2222:                          type     := Type, 
 2223:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2224:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2225:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2226:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2227:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2228:                                    ERROR
 2229:                            end
 2230:                    end},
 2231:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2232:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2233:                          type     := Type, 
 2234:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2235:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2236:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2237:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2238:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2239:                                    ERROR
 2240:                            end
 2241:                    end},
 2242:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2243:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2244: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2245: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2246: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2247: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2248: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2249: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2250:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2251:                            ok
 2252:                    end},
 2253: 
 2254: 
 2255:          %% The actual test
 2256:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2257:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2258:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2259:                                ok ->
 2260:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2261:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2262:                                    ERROR
 2263:                            end
 2264:                    end},
 2265: 
 2266:          %% *** We are done ***
 2267:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2268:         ],
 2269:

 2271:         [

 2276:                            ok

 2292:                    end},

 2297:                    end},

 2300: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),

 2305: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
