 2307: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
 2308: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
 2309:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2310:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2311:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2312:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2313:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2314: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2315: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2316: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2317: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2318: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2319: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2320: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2321: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2322: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2323: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2324: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2325: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2326:                    end},
 2327:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2328:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2329: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2330: 			   ok
 2331:                    end},
 2332:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2333:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2334: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2335: 			   ok
 2336:                    end},
 2337: 
 2338:          %% The actual test
 2339:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2340:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2341:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2342:                            ok
 2343:                    end},
 2344: 
 2345:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 2346:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2347:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2348:                                ok ->
 2349:                                    ok;
 2350:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2351:                                    ERROR
 2352:                            end
 2353:                    end},
 2354: 
 2355:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
 2356:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
 2357: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2358: 			   receive
 2359: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2360: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2361: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2362: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2363: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2364: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2365: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2366: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2367: 				   {ok, State3}
 2368: 			   after 5000 ->
 2369: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2370: 				   {error, timeout}
 2371: 			   end
 2372:                    end},
 2373:          #{desc => "await socket 2 down",
 2374:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock,
 2375: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 2376: 			   receive
 2377: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2378: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2379: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2380: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2381: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2382: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2383: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock2, State),
 2384: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon2,  State2),
 2385: 				   {ok, State3}
 2386: 			   after 5000 ->
 2387: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2388: 				   {error, timeout}
 2389: 			   end
 2390:                    end},
 2391:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2392:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2393: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2394: 			   receive
 2395: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2396: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2397: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2398: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2399: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2400: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2401: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2402: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2403: 				   {ok, State3}
 2404: 			   after 5000 ->
 2405: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2406: 				   {error, timeout}
 2407: 			   end
 2408:                    end},
 2409:          #{desc => "await socket 4 down",
 2410:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock,
 2411: 			 mon4  := MRef} = State) ->
 2412: 			   receive
 2413: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2414: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2415: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2416: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2417: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2418: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2419: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock4, State),
 2420: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon4,  State2),
 2421: 				   {ok, State3}
 2422: 			   after 5000 ->
 2423: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2424: 				   {error, timeout}
 2425: 			   end
 2426:                    end},
 2427:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2428:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2429: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2430: 			   receive
 2431: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2432: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2433: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2434: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2435: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2436: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2437: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2438: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2439: 				   {ok, State3}
 2440: 			   after 5000 ->
 2441: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2442: 				   {error, timeout}
 2443: 			   end
 2444:                    end},
 2445:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2446:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2447: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2448: 			   ok
 2449:                    end},
 2450:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2451:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2452: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2453: 			   ok
 2454:                    end},
 2455: 
 2456:          %% *** We are done ***
 2457:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2458:         ],
 2459: 
 2460:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2461:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2462: 
 2463:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 2464:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2465:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2466: 
 2467:     i("await evaluator"),
 2468:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 2469: 
 2470: 
 2471: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2472: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process, demonitor
 2473: %% two of them then close socket.
 2474: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN for
 2475: %% the sockets that are still monitored.
 2476: 
 2477: monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2478:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2479:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks,
 2480:            fun() ->
 2481: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2482:                                  type     => stream,
 2483:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2484:                    ok = mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 2485:            end).
 2486: 
 2487: 
 2488: mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2489:     OwnerSeq =
 2490:         [
 2491:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2492:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2493:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2494:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2495:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2496:                    end},
 2497:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2498:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2499:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2500:                            ok
 2501:                    end},
 2502: 
 2503:          %% *** Init part ***
 2504:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2505:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2506:                          type     := Type, 
 2507:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2508:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2509:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2510:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2511:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2512:                                    ERROR
 2513:                            end
 2514:                    end},
 2515:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2516:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2517:                          type     := Type, 
 2518:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2519:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2520:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2521:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2522:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2523:                                    ERROR
 2524:                            end
 2525:                    end},
 2526:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2527:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2528:                          type     := Type, 
 2529:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2530:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2531:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2532:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2533:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2534:                                    ERROR
 2535:                            end
 2536:                    end},
 2537:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2538:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2539:                          type     := Type, 
 2540:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2541:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2542:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2543:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2544:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2545:                                    ERROR
 2546:                            end
 2547:                    end},
 2548:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2549:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2550:                          type     := Type, 
 2551:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2552:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2553:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2554:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2555:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2556:                                    ERROR
 2557:                            end
 2558:                    end},
 2559:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2560:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2561: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2562: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2563: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2564: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2565: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2566: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2567:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2568:                            ok
 2569:                    end},
 2570: 
 2571:          %% The actual test
 2572:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 2573:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2574:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 2575:                    end},
 2576:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 2577:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 2578:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2579: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 2580:                    end},
 2581: 
 2582:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 2583:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2584:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 2585:                    end},
 2586:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 2587:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 2588:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2589: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 2590:                    end},
 2591: 
 2592:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 2593:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2594:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 2595:                    end},
 2596:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 2597:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 2598:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2599: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 2600:                    end},
 2601: 
 2602:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2603:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2604:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2605:                                ok ->
 2606:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2607:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2608:                                    ERROR
 2609:                            end
 2610:                    end},
 2611: 
 2612:          %% *** We are done ***
 2613:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2614:         ],
 2615: 
 2616:     TesterSeq =
 2617:         [
 2618:          %% *** Init part ***
 2619:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 2620:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 2621:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 2622:                            ok
 2623:                    end},
 2624:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 2625:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2626:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 2627:                            ok
 2628:                    end},
 2629:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 2630:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 2631:                            {ok, [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5]} =
 2632: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 2633:                            {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock1,
 2634: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
 2635: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
 2636: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
 2637: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
 2638:                    end},
 2639:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2640:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2641: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2642: 			   ok
 2643:                    end},
 2644:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2645:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2646: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2647: 			   ok
 2648:                    end},
 2649:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 2650:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock1,
 2651: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
 2652: 			 sock3 := Sock3,
 2653: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
 2654: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
 2655:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2656:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2657:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2658:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2659:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2660: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2661: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2662: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2663: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2664: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2665: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2666: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2667: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2668: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2669: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2670: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2671: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2672:                    end},
 2673:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2674:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2675: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2676: 			   ok
 2677:                    end},
 2678:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2679:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2680: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2681: 			   ok
 2682:                    end},
 2683: 
 2684:          %% The actual test
 2685:          #{desc => "demonitor socket(s)",
 2686:            cmd  => fun(#{mon2 := MRef2,
 2687: 			 mon4 := MRef4} = State) ->
 2688:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef2),
 2689:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef4),
 2690: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("cancel socket monitor 2 and 4"),
 2691: 			   State2 = maps:remove(mon2,  State),
 2692: 			   State3 = maps:remove(sock2, State2),
 2693: 			   State4 = maps:remove(mon4,  State3),
 2694: 			   State5 = maps:remove(sock4, State4),
 2695: 			   {ok, State5}
 2696:                    end},
 2697:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=3)",
 2698:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2699: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2700: 			   ok
 2701:                    end},
 2702:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=3)",
 2703:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2704: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2705: 			   ok
 2706:                    end},
 2707:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
 2708:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2709:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
 2710:                            ok
 2711:                    end},
 2712:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
 2713:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
 2714: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2715: 			   receive
 2716: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2717: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2718: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2719: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2720: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2721: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2722: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2723: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2724: 				   {ok, State3}
 2725: 			   after 5000 ->
 2726: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2727: 				   {error, timeout}
 2728: 			   end
 2729:                    end},
 2730:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 2731:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2732: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2733: 			   ok
 2734:                    end},
 2735:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 2736:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2737: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2738: 			   ok
 2739:                    end},
 2740: 
 2741:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 3",
 2742:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2743:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close3),
 2744:                            ok
 2745:                    end},
 2746:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2747:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2748: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2749: 			   receive
 2750: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2751: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2752: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2753: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2754: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2755: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2756: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2757: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2758: 				   {ok, State3}
 2759: 			   after 5000 ->
 2760: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2761: 				   {error, timeout}
 2762: 			   end
 2763:                    end},
 2764:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 2765:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2766: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2767: 			   ok
 2768:                    end},
 2769:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 2770:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2771: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2772: 			   ok
 2773:                    end},
 2774: 
 2775:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 5",
 2776:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2777:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close5),
 2778:                            ok
 2779:                    end},
 2780:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2781:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2782: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2783: 			   receive
 2784: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2785: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2786: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2787: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2788: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2789: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2790: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2791: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2792: 				   {ok, State3}
 2793: 			   after 5000 ->
 2794: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2795: 				   {error, timeout}
 2796: 			   end
 2797:                    end},
 2798:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2799:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2800: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2801: 			   ok
 2802:                    end},
 2803:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2804:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2805: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2806: 			   ok
 2807:                    end},
 2808: 
 2809:          %% Cleanup
 2810:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2811:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2812:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2813:                            ok
 2814:                    end},
 2815: 
 2816:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 2817:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2818:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2819:                                ok ->
 2820:                                    ok;
 2821:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2822:                                    ERROR
 2823:                            end
 2824:                    end},
 2825: 
 2826:          %% *** We are done ***
 2827:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2828:         ],
 2829: 
 2830:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2831:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2832: 
 2833:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 2834:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2835:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2836: 
 2837:     i("await evaluator"),
 2838:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 2839: 
 2840: 
 2841: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2842: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 2843: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 2844: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2845: 
 2846: monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2847:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2848:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon,
 2849:            fun() ->
 2850: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2851:                                  type     => stream,
 2852:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2853:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState)
 2854:            end).

 2864:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2865:                    end},

 2868:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2869:                            ok
 2870:                    end},
 2871:

 2873:          #{desc => "create socket",
 2874:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain,

 2877:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2878:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2879:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 2880:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2881:                                    ERROR
 2882:                            end
 2883:                    end},

 2886:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 2887:                            ok
 2888:                    end},

 2893:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 2894:                    end},

 3403:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3404: 
 3405:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 3406:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3407: 
 3408:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 3409:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3410: 
 3411:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3412:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3413: 
 3414:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3415:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3416: 
 3417:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3418:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3419: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3420: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3421: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3422: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3423: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3424:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3425: 
 3426:     i("await evaluator"),
 3427:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3428: 
 3429: 
 3430: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3431: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 3432: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 3433: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 3434: 
 3435: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3436:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 3437:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon,
 3438:            fun() ->
 3439: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 3440:                                  type     => stream,
 3441:                                  protocol => tcp},
 3442:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState)
 3443:            end).
 3444: 
 3445: 
 3446: mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 3447:     OwnerSeq =
 3448:         [
 3449:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3450:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3451:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3452:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3453:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3454:                    end},
 3455:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3456:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3457:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3458:                            ok
 3459:                    end},
 3460: 
 3461:          %% *** Init part ***
 3462:          #{desc => "create socket",
 3463:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 3464:                          type     := Type, 
 3465:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 3466:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 3467:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 3468:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 3469:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3470:                                    ERROR
 3471:                            end
 3472:                    end},
 3473:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3474:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 3475:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 3476:                            ok
 3477:                    end},
 3478: 
 3479:          %% The actual test
 3480:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3481:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3482:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3483:                                ok ->
 3484:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3485:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3486:                                    ERROR
 3487:                            end
 3488:                    end},
 3489: 
 3490:          %% *** We are done ***
 3491:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3492:         ],
 3493: 
 3494: 
 3495:     ClientSeq =
 3496:         [
 3497:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3498:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3499:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3500:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3501:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3502:                    end},
 3503:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3504:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3505:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3506:                            ok
 3507:                    end},
 3508: 
 3509:          %% *** Init part ***
 3510:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3511:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3512:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 3513:                            ok
 3514:                    end},
 3515:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 3516:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3517:                            {ok, Sock} =
 3518: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 3519: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: ~p", [Sock]),
 3520: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 3521:                    end},
 3522: 
 3523: 
 3524:          %% The actual test
 3525:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 3526:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3527:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 3528:                    end},
 3529:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3530:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3531: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3532: 			   ok
 3533:                    end},
 3534:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 3535:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 3536:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 3537: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 3538: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 3539:                    end},
 3540:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 3541:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3542: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3543: 			   ok
 3544:                    end},
 3545: 
 3546:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 3547:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3548:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 3549:                            ok
 3550:                    end},
 3551: 
 3552:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 3553:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3554:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 3555:                    end},
 3556: 
 3557:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 3558:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 3559: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 3560: 			   receive
 3561: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 3562: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 3563: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 3564: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 3565: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 3566: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 3567: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon, State),
 3568: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 3569: 				   {ok, State3}
 3570: 			   after 5000 ->
 3571: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 3572: 				   {error, timeout}
 3573: 			   end
 3574:                    end},
 3575:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3576:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3577: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3578: 			   ok
 3579:                    end},
 3580: 
 3581:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 3582:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3583:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 3584:                            ok
 3585:                    end},
 3586: 
 3587: 
 3588:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3589:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3590:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3591:                                ok ->
 3592:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3593:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3594:                                    ERROR
 3595:                            end
 3596:                    end},
 3597: 
 3598:          %% *** We are done ***
 3599:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3600:         ],

 3950:         ],
 3951: 
 3952:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 3953:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 3954: 
 3955:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 3956:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3957: 
 3958:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 3959:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3960: 
 3961:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 3962:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3963: 
 3964:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3965:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3966: 
 3967:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3968:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3969: 
 3970:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3971:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3972: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3973: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3974: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3975: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3976: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3977:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3978: 
 3979:     i("await evaluator"),
 3980:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3981: 
 3982: 
 3983: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3984: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 3985: %% different processes, then close each socket (from 'owner').
 3986: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 3987: %% each socket.
 3988: 
 3989: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3990:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 3991:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 3992:            fun() ->
 3993:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 3994:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 3995:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 3996:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 3997:                        _ ->
 3998:                            ok
 3999:                    end
 4000:            end,
 4001:            fun() ->
 4002: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4003:                                  type     => stream,
 4004:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4005:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4006:            end).
 4007: 
 4008: 
 4009: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4010:     OwnerSeq =
 4011:         [
 4012:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4013:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4014:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4015:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4016:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4017:                    end},
 4018:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4019:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4020:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4021:                            ok
 4022:                    end},
 4023: 
 4024:          %% *** Init part ***
 4025:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4026:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4027:                          type     := Type, 
 4028:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4029:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4030:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4031:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4032:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4033:                                    ERROR
 4034:                            end
 4035:                    end},
 4036:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4037:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4038:                          type     := Type, 
 4039:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4040:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4041:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4042:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 4043:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4044:                                    ERROR
 4045:                            end
 4046:                    end},
 4047:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 4048:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4049:                          type     := Type, 
 4050:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4051:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4052:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4053:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 4054:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4055:                                    ERROR
 4056:                            end
 4057:                    end},
 4058:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 4059:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4060:                          type     := Type, 
 4061:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4062:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4063:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4064:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 4065:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4066:                                    ERROR
 4067:                            end
 4068:                    end},
 4069:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 4070:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4071:                          type     := Type, 
 4072:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4073:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4074:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4075:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 4076:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4077:                                    ERROR
 4078:                            end
 4079:                    end},
 4080:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 4081:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 4082: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 4083: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 4084: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 4085: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 4086: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 4087: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 4088:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 4089:                            ok
 4090:                    end},
 4091: 
 4092:          %% The actual test
 4093:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 4094:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4095:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 4096:                    end},
 4097:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 4098:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 4099:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4100: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 4101:                    end},
 4102: 
 4103:          #{desc => "await continue (close2)",
 4104:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4105:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close2)
 4106:                    end},
 4107:          #{desc => "close socket 2",
 4108:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock} = State) ->
 4109:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4110: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock2, State)}
 4111:                    end},
 4112: 
 4113:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 4114:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4115:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 4116:                    end},
 4117:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 4118:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 4119:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4120: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 4121:                    end},
 4122: 
 4123:          #{desc => "await continue (close4)",
 4124:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4125:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close4)
 4126:                    end},
 4127:          #{desc => "close socket 4",
 4128:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock} = State) ->
 4129:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4130: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock4, State)}
 4131:                    end},
 4132: 
 4133:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 4134:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4135:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 4136:                    end},
 4137:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 4138:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 4139:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4140: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 4141:                    end},
 4142: 
 4143: 
 4144:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 4145:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 4146:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 4147:                                ok ->
 4148:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 4149:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4150:                                    ERROR
 4151:                            end
 4152:                    end},
 4153: 
 4154:          %% *** We are done ***
 4155:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 4156:         ],
 4157:

 4191: 				       sock2 => Sock2,

 4193: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
 4194: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
 4195:                    end},

 4201:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 4202:                    end},

 4219:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),

 4221: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 4222: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 4223: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 4224: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 4225: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 4226: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 4227: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 4228: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 4229: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 4230: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 4231: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 4232:                    end},

 4915:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 4916:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 4917: 
 4918:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 4919:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4920: 
 4921:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),

 4923: 
 4924:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),

 4926:

 4929: 
 4930:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 4931:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4932: 
 4933:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 4934:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 4935: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 4936: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 4937: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 4938: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 4939: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 4940:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 4941: 
 4942:     i("await evaluator"),
 4943:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 4944: 
 4945: 
 4946: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4947: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 4948: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 4949: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 4950: %% each socket.
 4951: 
 4952: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4953:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 4954:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 4955:            fun() ->
 4956:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 4957:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 4958:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 4959:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 4960:                        _ ->
 4961:                            ok
 4962:                    end
 4963:            end,
 4964:            fun() ->
 4965: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4966:                                  type     => stream,
 4967:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4968:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4969:            end).
 4970: 
 4971: 
 4972: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4973:     OwnerSeq =
 4974:         [
 4975:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4976:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4977:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4978:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4979:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4980:                    end},
 4981:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4982:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4983:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4984:                            ok
 4985:                    end},
 4986: 
 4987:          %% *** Init part ***
 4988:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4989:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4990:                          type     := Type, 
 4991:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4992:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4993:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4994:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4995:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4996:                                    ERROR
 4997:                            end
 4998:                    end},
 4999:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 5000:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5001:                          type     := Type, 
 5002:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5003:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5004:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5005:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 5006:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5007:                                    ERROR
 5008:                            end
 5009:                    end},
 5010:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 5011:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5012:                          type     := Type, 
 5013:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5014:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5015:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5016:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};

 5548:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5549:                            ok
 5550:                    end},
 5551:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5552:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5553:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5554:                                ok ->
 5555:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5556:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5557:                                    ERROR
 5558:                            end
 5559:                    end},
 5560: 
 5561:          #{desc => "await (client 1) ready",
 5562:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5563:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, down)
 5564:                    end},
 5565:          #{desc => "await (client 2) ready",
 5566:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5567:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, down)
 5568:                    end},
 5569:          #{desc => "await (client 3) ready",
 5570:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5571:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, down)
 5572:                    end},
 5573:          #{desc => "await (client 4) ready",
 5574:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5575:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client4, down)
 5576:                    end},
 5577:          #{desc => "await (client 5) ready",
 5578:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5579:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client5, down)
 5580:                    end},
 5581: 
 5582: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5583:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5584: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5585: 			   ok
 5586:                    end},
 5587: 
 5588: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5589: 
 5590:          %% Cleanup
 5591:          #{desc => "order (client 1) terminate",
 5592:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5593:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5594:                            ok
 5595:                    end},
 5596:          #{desc => "await (client 1) termination",
 5597:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 5598:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5599:                                ok ->
 5600:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client1, State)};
 5601:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5602:                                    ERROR
 5603:                            end
 5604:                    end},
 5605: 
 5606:          #{desc => "order (client 2) terminate",
 5607:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5608:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5609:                            ok
 5610:                    end},
 5611:          #{desc => "await (client 2) termination",
 5612:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 5613:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5614:                                ok ->
 5615:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client2, State)};
 5616:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5617:                                    ERROR
 5618:                            end
 5619:                    end},
 5620: 
 5621:          #{desc => "order (client 3) terminate",
 5622:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5623:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5624:                            ok
 5625:                    end},
 5626:          #{desc => "await (client 3) termination",
 5627:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 5628:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5629:                                ok ->
 5630:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client3, State)};
 5631:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5632:                                    ERROR
 5633:                            end
 5634:                    end},
 5635: 
 5636:          #{desc => "order (client 4) terminate",
 5637:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5638:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5639:                            ok
 5640:                    end},
 5641:          #{desc => "await (client 4) termination",
 5642:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = State) ->
 5643:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5644:                                ok ->
 5645:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client4, State)};
 5646:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5647:                                    ERROR
 5648:                            end
 5649:                    end},
 5650: 
 5651:          #{desc => "order (client 5) terminate",
 5652:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5653:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5654:                            ok
 5655:                    end},
 5656:          #{desc => "await (client 5) termination",
 5657:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = State) ->
 5658:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5659:                                ok ->
 5660:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client5, State)};
 5661:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5662:                                    ERROR
 5663:                            end
 5664:                    end},
 5665: 
 5666:          %% *** We are done ***
 5667:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5668:         ],
 5669: 
 5670:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5671:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5672: 
 5673:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 5674:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5675: 
 5676:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 5677:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5678: 
 5679:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 5680:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5681: 
 5682:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 5683:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5684: 
 5685:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 5686:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5687: 
 5688:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5689:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 5690: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 5691: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 5692: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 5693: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 5694: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 5695:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5696: 
 5697:     i("await evaluator"),
 5698:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 5699: 
 5700: 
 5701: 
 5702: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5703: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 5704: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 5705: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 5706: %% each socket.
 5707: 
 5708: monitor_closed_socket(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5709:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 5710:     tc_try(monitor_closed_socket,
 5711:            fun() ->
 5712: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5713:                                  type     => stream,
 5714:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5715:                    ok = mon_closed_socket(InitState)
 5716:            end).
 5717: 
 5718: 
 5719: mon_closed_socket(InitState) ->
 5720:     OwnerSeq =
 5721:         [
 5722:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5723:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5724:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5725:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5726:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5727:                    end},
 5728:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5729:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5730:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5731:                            ok
 5732:                    end},
 5733: 
 5734:          %% *** Init part ***
 5735:          #{desc => "create socket",
 5736:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5737:                          type     := Type, 
 5738:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5739:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5740:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5741:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 5742:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5743:                                    ERROR
 5744:                            end
 5745:                    end},
 5746:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5747:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 5748: 			 sock   := Sock} = State) ->
 5749:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 5750:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 5751:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 5752:                    end},
 5753: 
 5754:          %% The actual test
 5755:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5756:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5757:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5758:                                ok ->
 5759:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5760:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5761:                                    ERROR
 5762:                            end
 5763:                    end},
 5764: 
 5765:          %% *** We are done ***
 5766:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5767:         ],
 5768: 
 5769: 
 5770:     ClientSeq =
 5771:         [
 5772:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5773:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5774:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5775:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5776:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5777:                    end},
 5778:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5779:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5780:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5781:                            ok
 5782:                    end},
 5783: 
 5784:          %% *** Init part ***
 5785:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5786:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5787:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 5788:                            ok
 5789:                    end},
 5790:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 5791:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5792:                            {ok, Sock} =
 5793:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 5794: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: "
 5795: 				       "~n      ~p", [Sock]),
 5796: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5797:                    end},
 5798: 
 5799: 
 5800:          %% The actual test
 5801:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 5802:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5803:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 5804:                    end},
 5805: 
 5806:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 5807:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 5808:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 5809: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 5810: 				       "~n      ~p", [MRef]),
 5811: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 5812:                    end},
 5813:          
 5814:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 5815:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5816:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 5817:                            ok
 5818:                    end},
 5819: 
 5820:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 5821:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5822:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 5823:                    end},
 5824: 
 5825:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 5826:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 5827: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 5828: 			   receive
 5829: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 5830: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 5831: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 5832: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 5833: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 5834: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 5835: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
 5836: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 5837: 				   {ok, State3}
 5838: 			   after 1000 ->
 5839: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 5840: 				   {error, timeout}
 5841: 			   end
 5842:                    end},
 5843: 
 5844:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 5845:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5846:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 5847:                            ok
 5848:                    end},
 5849: 
 5850: 
 5851:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5852:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5853:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5854:                                ok ->
 5855:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5856:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5857:                                    ERROR
 5858:                            end
 5859:                    end},
 5860: 
 5861:          %% *** We are done ***
 5862:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5863:         ],
 5864: 
 5865:     TesterSeq =
 5866:         [
 5867:          %% *** Init part ***
 5868:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
 5869:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 5870:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 5871:                            ok
 5872:                    end},
 5873:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 5874:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5875:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5876:                            ok
 5877:                    end},
 5878:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 5879:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5880:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 5881:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5882:                    end},
 5883: 
 5884:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 5885:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5886:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 5887:                            ok
 5888:                    end},
 5889:          #{desc => "order client start",
 5890:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5891:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5892:                            ok
 5893:                    end},
 5894:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5895:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5896:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 5897:                    end},
 5898:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
 5899:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 5900: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
 5901:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
 5902:                            ok
 5903:                    end},
 5904: 
 5905:          %% The actual test
 5906:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
 5907:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
 5908:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
 5909:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5910:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
 5911:                            ok
 5912:                    end},
 5913:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5914:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5915:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
 5916:                    end},
 5917: 
 5918:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
 5919:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5920:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
 5921:                            ok
 5922:                    end},
 5923: 
 5924: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5925: 
 5926:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 5927:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5928:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5929:                            ok
 5930:                    end},
 5931:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5932:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5933:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5934:                                ok ->
 5935:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5936:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5937:                                    ERROR
 5938:                            end
 5939:                    end},
 5940: 
 5941:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5942:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5943:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
 5944:                    end},
 5945: 
 5946: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5947:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5948: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5949: 			   ok
 5950:                    end},
 5951: 
 5952: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5953: 
 5954:          %% Cleanup
 5955:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 5956:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5957:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5958:                            ok
 5959:                    end},
 5960:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 5961:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 5962:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5963:                                ok ->
 5964:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 5965:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5966:                                    ERROR
 5967:                            end
 5968:                    end},
 5969: 
 5970:          %% *** We are done ***
 5971:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5972:         ],
 5973: 
 5974:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5975:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5976: 
 5977:     i("start client  evaluator"),
 5978:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5979: 
 5980:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5981:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
 5982: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
 5983:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5984: 
 5985:     i("await evaluator"),
 5986:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
 5987:

 5990: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5991: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

 5998: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5999: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6000: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6001: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
 6002: 
 6003: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6004:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6005:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
 6006:            fun() ->
 6007:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6008:                                  type     => stream,
 6009:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6010:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6011:            end).
 6012: 
 6013: 
 6014: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6015: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6016: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6017: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
 6018: 
 6019: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6020:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6021:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
 6022:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6023:            fun() ->
 6024:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6025:                                  type     => stream,
 6026:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6027:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6028:            end).
 6029: 
 6030: 
 6031: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6032: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6033: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6034: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
 6035: 
 6036: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6037:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6038:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
 6039:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 6040:            fun() ->
 6041:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6042:                                  type     => stream,
 6043:                                  protocol => default},
 6044:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6045:            end).
 6046: 
 6047: 
 6048: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6049: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6050: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6051: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6052: 
 6053: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6054:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6055:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
 6056:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6057:            fun() ->
 6058:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6059:                                  type     => dgram,
 6060:                                  protocol => udp},
 6061:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6062:            end).

 6066: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6067: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6068: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6069: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6070: 
 6071: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6072:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),

 6075:            fun() ->

 6080:            end).
 6081: 
 6082: 
 6083: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6084: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6085: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6086: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
 6087: 
 6088: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6089:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6090:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
 6091:            fun() ->
 6092: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6093: 		   is_not_windows()
 6094: 	   end,
 6095:            fun() ->
 6096:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6097:                                  type     => dgram,
 6098:                                  protocol => default},
 6099:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6100:            end).
 6101:
