 6104: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6105: 
 6106: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
 6107:     OwnerSeq =
 6108:         [
 6109:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6110:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6111:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6112:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6113:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6114:                    end},
 6115:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6116:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6117:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6118:                            ok
 6119:                    end},
 6120: 
 6121:          %% *** Init part ***
 6122:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6123:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6124:                          type     := Type, 
 6125:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6126:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 6127:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6128:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6129:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6130:                                    ERROR
 6131:                            end
 6132:                    end},
 6133:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6134:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6135:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6136:                            ok
 6137:                    end},
 6138: 
 6139:          %% *** The actual test ***
 6140:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
 6141:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6142:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6143:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6144:                                ok ->
 6145:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6146:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6147:                                    ERROR
 6148:                            end
 6149:                    end},
 6150: 
 6151:          %% *** We are done ***
 6152:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6153:         ],
 6154: 
 6155:     TesterSeq =
 6156:         [
 6157:          %% *** Init part ***
 6158:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 6159:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 6160:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 6161:                            ok
 6162:                    end},
 6163:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 6164:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6165:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6166:                            ok
 6167:                    end},
 6168:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 6169:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 6170:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 6171:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6172:                    end},
 6173:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
 6174:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6175:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6176:                                {ok, Pid} ->
 6177:                                    ok;
 6178:                                {ok, Other} ->
 6179:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
 6180:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6181:                                    ERROR
 6182:                            end
 6183:                    end},
 6184:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 6185:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6186:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6187:                            ok
 6188:                    end},
 6189:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 6190:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6191:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6192:                                ok ->
 6193:                                    ok;
 6194:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6195:                                    ERROR
 6196:                            end
 6197:                    end},
 6198: 
 6199:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 6200: 
 6201:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
 6202:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
 6203:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
 6204:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
 6205:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
 6206:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
 6207:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
 6208:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6209:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6210:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
 6211:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
 6212:                                {error, closed} ->
 6213:                                    ok;
 6214:                                {error, Reason} ->
 6215:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 6216:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
 6217:                            end
 6218:                    end},
 6219: 
 6220:          %% *** We are done ***
 6221:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6222:         ],
 6223: 
 6224:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 6225:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 6226: 
 6227:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6228:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 6229:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6230: 
 6231:     i("await evaluator"),
 6232:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 6233: 
 6234: 
 6235: 
 6236: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6237: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6238: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
 6239: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6240: %% 
 6241: %% <KOLLA>
 6242: %% 
 6243: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
 6244: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
 6245: %% all the other functions.
 6246: %% 
 6247: %% </KOLLA>
 6248: 
 6249: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6250:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6251:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
 6252:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6253:            fun() ->
 6254:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6255:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6256:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6257:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6258:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6259:            end).
 6260: 
 6261: 
 6262: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6263: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6264: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6265: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6266: 
 6267: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6268:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6269:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
 6270:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6271:            fun() ->
 6272:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6273:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6274:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6275:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6276:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6277:            end).
 6278: 
 6279: 
 6280: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6281: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6282: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6283: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 6284: 
 6285: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6286:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6287:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
 6288:            fun() ->
 6289: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
 6290: 	   end,
 6291:            fun() ->
 6292:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6293:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6294:                                  protocol => default,
 6295:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6296:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6297:            end).
 6298: 
 6299: 
 6300: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6301: 
 6302: sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 6303:     %% This (acceptor) is the server that accepts connections.
 6304:     %% But it is also suppose to close the connection socket, 
 6305:     %% and trigger the read failure (=closed) for the handler process.
 6306:     AcceptorSeq =
 6307:         [
 6308:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6309:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6310:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6311:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6312:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6313:                    end},
 6314:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6315:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6316:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6317:                            ok
 6318:                    end},
 6319: 
 6320:          %% *** Init part ***
 6321:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6322:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6323:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6324:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 6325:                    end},
 6326:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 6327:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6328:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6329:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6330:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6331:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 6332:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6333:                                    ERROR
 6334:                            end
 6335:                    end},
 6336:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 6337:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6338:                          lsock  := LSock,
 6339:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 6340:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6341:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6342:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6343:                                ok ->
 6344:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 6345:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6346:                                    ERROR
 6347:                            end;
 6348:                       (#{lsock := LSock,
 6349:                          lsa   := LSA} = State) ->
 6350:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6351:                                ok ->
 6352:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 6353:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
 6354:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 6355:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6356:                                    ERROR
 6357:                            end
 6358:                    end},
 6359:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 6360:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 6361:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 6362:                    end},
 6363:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6364:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6365:                          tester := Tester,
 6366:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}}) ->
 6367:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 6368:                            ok;
 6369:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
 6370:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 6371:                            ok
 6372:                    end},
 6373:                            
 6374:          %% The actual test
 6375:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 6376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6377:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 6378:                                {ok, {H1, H2, H3}} ->
 6379:                                    {ok, State#{handler1 => H1,
 6380:                                                handler2 => H2,
 6381:                                                handler3 => H3}};
 6382:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6383:                                    ERROR
 6384:                            end
 6385:                    end},
 6386:          #{desc => "await accept",
 6387:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 6388:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 6389:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6390:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("connection accepted: "
 6391:                                                "~n   ~p", [socket:sockname(Sock)]),
 6392:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
 6393:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6394:                                    ERROR
 6395:                            end
 6396:                    end},
 6397:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 6398:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6399:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 6400:                            ok
 6401:                    end},
 6402:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 1",
 6403:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6404:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6405:                            ok
 6406:                    end},
 6407:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 2",
 6408:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6409:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6410:                            ok
 6411:                    end},
 6412:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 3",
 6413:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6414:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6415:                            ok
 6416:                    end},
 6417:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 6418:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6419:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close),
 6420:                            ok
 6421:                    end},
 6422:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
 6423:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 6424:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6425:                                ok ->
 6426:                                    {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)};
 6427:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6428:                                    ERROR
 6429:                            end
 6430:                    end},
 6431:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 6432:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6433:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 6434:                            ok
 6435:                    end},
 6436: 
 6437:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6438:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6439:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6440:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6441:                                ok ->
 6442:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6443:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6444:                                    ERROR
 6445:                            end
 6446:                    end},
 6447:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 6448:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6449:                          lsock  := Sock,
 6450:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6451:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 6452:                            State1 =
 6453:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6454:                                            fun() ->maps:remove(lsa, State) end,
 6455:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6456:                            State2 = maps:remove(lsock, State1),
 6457:                            State3 = maps:remove(lport, State2),
 6458:                            {ok, State3};
 6459:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
 6460:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6461:                                ok ->
 6462:                                    State1 = maps:remove(lsock, State),
 6463:                                    State2 = maps:remove(lport, State1),
 6464:                                    {ok, State2};
 6465:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6466:                                    ERROR
 6467:                            end
 6468:                    end},
 6469: 
 6470:          %% *** We are done ***
 6471:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6472:         ],
 6473: 
 6474:     %% The point of this is to perform the recv for which
 6475:     %% we are testing the response.
 6476:     HandlerSeq =
 6477:         [
 6478:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6479:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6480:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6481:                            {Tester, Acceptor} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6482:                            {ok, State#{tester  => Tester, 
 6483:                                       acceptor => Acceptor}}
 6484:                    end},
 6485:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6486:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6487:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6488:                            ok
 6489:                    end},
 6490:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6491:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor} = _State) ->
 6492:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Acceptor),
 6493:                            ok
 6494:                    end},
 6495:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6496:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6497:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6498:                            ok
 6499:                    end},
 6500: 
 6501:          %% The actual test
 6502:          #{desc => "await continue (transfer)",
 6503:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6504:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Pid, acceptor, transfer) of
 6505:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6506:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6507:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6508:                                    ERROR
 6509:                            end
 6510:                    end},
 6511:          #{desc => "announce ready (transfer)",
 6512:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6513:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, transfer),
 6514:                            ok
 6515:                    end},
 6516:          #{desc => "attempt recv (=> closed)",
 6517:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 6518:                            %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 6519:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 6520:                                {ok, _Data} ->
 6521:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected data received"),
 6522:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 6523:                                {error, closed} ->
 6524:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected 'closed' "
 6525:                                                "result"),
 6526:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sock, State),
 6527:                                    {ok, State1};
 6528:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6529:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected read failure: "
 6530:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6531:                                    ERROR
 6532:                            end
 6533:                    end},
 6534:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 6535:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6536:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 6537:                            ok
 6538:                    end},
 6539: 
 6540:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6541:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6542:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6543:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6544:                                ok ->
 6545:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6546:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6547:                                    ERROR
 6548:                            end
 6549:                    end},
 6550: 
 6551: 
 6552:          %% *** We are done ***
 6553:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6554:         ],
 6555: 
 6556:     %% The point of this is basically just to create the connection.
 6557:     ClientSeq =
 6558:         [
 6559:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6560:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6561:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6562:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6563:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6564:                    end},
 6565:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6566:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6567:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6568:                            ok
 6569:                    end},
 6570: 
 6571:          %% *** Init part ***
 6572:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6573:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6574:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6575:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 6576:                    end},
 6577:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6578:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6579:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6580:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6581:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6582:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6583:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6584:                                    ERROR
 6585:                            end
 6586:                    end},
 6587:          #{desc => "bind socket to local address",
 6588:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 6589:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6590:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6591:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6592:                                ok ->
 6593:                                    ok;
 6594:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6595:                                    ERROR
 6596:                            end
 6597:                    end},
 6598:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6599:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6600:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6601:                            ok
 6602:                    end},
 6603: 
 6604:          %% The actual test
 6605:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 6606:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain,
 6607:                          tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6608:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6609:                                {ok, ServerPath} ->
 6610:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Server Path: "
 6611:                                                "~n   ~s", [ServerPath]),
 6612:                                    ServerSA = #{family => Domain,
 6613:                                                 path   => ServerPath},
 6614:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6615:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6616:                                    ERROR
 6617:                            end;
 6618:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 6619:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6620:                                {ok, Port} ->
 6621:                                    ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 6622:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6623:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6624:                                    ERROR
 6625:                            end
 6626:                    end},
 6627:          #{desc => "connect to server",
 6628:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
 6629:                            socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA)
 6630:                    end},
 6631:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
 6632:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6633:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 6634:                            ok
 6635:                    end},
 6636: 
 6637:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6638:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6639:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6640:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6641:                                ok ->
 6642:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6643:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6644:                                    ERROR
 6645:                            end                           
 6646:                    end},
 6647:          #{desc => "close socket",
 6648:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 6649:                          sock     := Sock,
 6650:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6651:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6652:                            State1 =
 6653:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6654:                                            fun() ->
 6655:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 6656:                                            end,
 6657:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6658:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 6659:                        (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 6660:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6661:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 6662:                    end},
 6663: 
 6664:          %% *** We are done ***
 6665:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6666:         ],
 6667: 
 6668:     TesterSeq =
 6669:         [
 6670:          %% *** Init part ***
 6671:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6672:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6673:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6674:                            ok
 6675:                    end},
 6676:          #{desc => "monitor handler 1",
 6677:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6678:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6679:                            ok
 6680:                    end},
 6681:          #{desc => "monitor handler 2",
 6682:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6683:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6684:                            ok
 6685:                    end},
 6686:          #{desc => "monitor handler 3",
 6687:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6688:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6689:                            ok
 6690:                    end},
 6691:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 6692:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6693:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6694:                            ok
 6695:                    end},
 6696: 
 6697:          %% Start the acceptor
 6698:          #{desc => "order acceptor start",
 6699:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6700:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6701:                            ok
 6702:                    end},
 6703:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (init)",
 6704:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6705:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, init) of
 6706:                                {ok, PortOrPath} ->
 6707:                                    {ok, State#{server_info => PortOrPath}};
 6708:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6709:                                    ERROR
 6710:                            end
 6711:                    end},
 6712: 
 6713:          %% Start the handler(s)
 6714:          #{desc => "order handler 1 start",
 6715:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6716:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6717:                            ok
 6718:                    end},
 6719:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 6720:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6721:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, init)
 6722:                    end},
 6723:          #{desc => "order handler 2 start",
 6724:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6725:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6726:                            ok
 6727:                    end},
 6728:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 6729:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6730:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, init)
 6731:                    end},
 6732:          #{desc => "order handler 3 start",
 6733:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6734:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6735:                            ok
 6736:                    end},
 6737:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 6738:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6739:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, init)
 6740:                    end},
 6741: 
 6742:          %% Start the client
 6743:          #{desc => "order client start",
 6744:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6745:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6746:                            ok
 6747:                    end},
 6748:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 6749:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6750:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 6751:                    end},
 6752: 
 6753:          %% The actual test
 6754:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (accept)",
 6755:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid, 
 6756:                          handler1 := H1, 
 6757:                          handler2 := H2, 
 6758:                          handler3 := H3} = _State) ->
 6759:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, {H1, H2, H3}),
 6760:                            ok
 6761:                    end},
 6762:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6763:          #{desc => "order client to continue (connect)",
 6764:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_info := Info} = _State) ->
 6765:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect, Info),
 6766:                            ok
 6767:                    end},
 6768:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (accept)",
 6769:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6770:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, accept)
 6771:                    end},
 6772:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
 6773:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6774:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, connect)
 6775:                    end},
 6776:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (transfer)",
 6777:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6778:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, transfer)
 6779:                    end},
 6780:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (transfer)",
 6781:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6782:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, transfer)
 6783:                    end},
 6784:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (transfer)",
 6785:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6786:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, transfer)
 6787:                    end},
 6788:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6789:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (close connection socket)",
 6790:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6791:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 6792:                            ok
 6793:                    end},
 6794:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (close)",
 6795:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6796:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, close)
 6797:                    end},
 6798:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (recv closed)",
 6799:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6800:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, recv_closed)
 6801:                    end},
 6802:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (recv closed)",
 6803:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6804:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, recv_closed)
 6805:                    end},
 6806:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (recv closed)",
 6807:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6808:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, recv_closed)
 6809:                    end},
 6810: 
 6811:          %% Terminations
 6812:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 6813:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6814:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6815:                            ok
 6816:                    end},
 6817:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 6818:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 6819:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6820:                                ok ->
 6821:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 6822:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6823:                                    ERROR
 6824:                            end
 6825:                    end},
 6826:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 6827:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6828:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6829:                            ok
 6830:                    end},
 6831:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 6832:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 6833:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6834:                                ok ->
 6835:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler1, State)};
 6836:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6837:                                    ERROR
 6838:                            end
 6839:                    end},
 6840:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 6841:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6842:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6843:                            ok
 6844:                    end},
 6845:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 6846:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 6847:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6848:                                ok ->
 6849:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler2, State)};
 6850:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6851:                                    ERROR
 6852:                            end
 6853:                    end},
 6854:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 6855:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6856:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6857:                            ok
 6858:                    end},
 6859:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 6860:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 6861:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6862:                                ok ->
 6863:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler3, State)};
 6864:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6865:                                    ERROR
 6866:                            end
 6867:                    end},
 6868:          #{desc => "order acceptor to terminate",
 6869:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6870:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6871:                            ok
 6872:                    end},
 6873:          #{desc => "await acceptor termination",
 6874:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6875:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6876:                                ok ->
 6877:                                    {ok, maps:remove(acceptor, State)};
 6878:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6879:                                    ERROR
 6880:                            end
 6881:                    end},
 6882: 
 6883: 
 6884:          %% *** We are done ***
 6885:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6886:         ],
 6887: 
 6888:     i("start acceptor evaluator"),
 6889:     AccInitState = InitState,
 6890:     Acceptor = ?SEV_START("acceptor", AcceptorSeq, AccInitState),
 6891: 
 6892:     i("start handler 1 evaluator"),
 6893:     HandlerInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 6894:     Handler1 = ?SEV_START("handler-1", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6895: 
 6896:     i("start handler 2 evaluator"),
 6897:     Handler2 = ?SEV_START("handler-2", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6898: 
 6899:     i("start handler 3 evaluator"),
 6900:     Handler3 = ?SEV_START("handler-3", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6901: 
 6902:     i("start client evaluator"),
 6903:     ClientInitState = InitState,
 6904:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 6905: 
 6906:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6907:     TesterInitState = #{acceptor => Acceptor#ev.pid,
 6908:                         handler1 => Handler1#ev.pid,
 6909:                         handler2 => Handler2#ev.pid,
 6910:                         handler3 => Handler3#ev.pid,
 6911:                         client   => Client#ev.pid},
 6912:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6913: 
 6914:     i("await evaluator"),
 6915:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Acceptor, 
 6916:                             Handler1, Handler2, Handler3, 
 6917:                             Client, Tester]).
 6918: 
 6919: 
 6920: 
 6921: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6922: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6923: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recvfrom function.
 6924: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6925: %% 
 6926: 
 6927: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6928:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6929:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6930:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6931:            fun() ->
 6932:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6933:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6934:                                end,
 6935:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6936:                                  protocol => udp,
 6937:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6938:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6939:            end).
 6940: 
 6941: 
 6942: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6943: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6944: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6945: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6946: 
 6947: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6948:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6949:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6950:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6951:            fun() ->
 6952:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6953:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6954:                                end,
 6955:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6956:                                  protocol => udp,
 6957:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6958:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6959:            end).
 6960: 
 6961: 
 6962: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6963: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6964: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6965: %% Socket is Unix Domainm (dgram) socket.
 6966: 
 6967: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6968:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6969:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6970:            fun() ->
 6971: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6972: 		   is_not_windows()
 6973: 	   end,
 6974:            fun() ->
 6975:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6976:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6977:                                end,
 6978:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6979:                                  protocol => default,
 6980:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6981:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6982:            end).
 6983: 
 6984: 
 6985: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6986: 
 6987: sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState) ->
 6988:     PrimServerSeq =
 6989:         [
 6990:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6991:          #{desc => "await start",
 6992:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6993:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6994:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6995:                    end},
 6996:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6997:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6998:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6999:                            ok
 7000:                    end},
 7001: 
 7002:          %% *** Init part ***
 7003:          #{desc => "local address",
 7004:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7005:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7006:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 7007:                    end},
 7008:          #{desc => "open socket",
 7009:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7010:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
 7011:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7012:                    end},
 7013:          #{desc => "bind socket",
 7014:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA}) ->
 7015:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7016:                                ok ->
 7017:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
 7018:                                    ok;
 7019:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 7020:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
 7021:                                    ERROR
 7022:                            end
 7023:                    end},
 7024:          #{desc => "socket name",
 7025:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7026:                            case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 7027:                                {ok, SA} ->
 7028:                                    {ok, State#{sa => SA}};
 7029:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 7030:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 7031:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 7032:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7033:                                    {skip, Reason};
 7034:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 7035:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 7036:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 7037:                                    ERROR
 7038:                            end
 7039:                    end},
 7040:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7041:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock}) ->
 7042:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7043:                            ok
 7044:                    end},
 7045: 
 7046:          %% The actual test
 7047:          #{desc => "await continue (recv, with timeout)",
 7048:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7049:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv) of
 7050:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7051:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7052:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7053:                                    ERROR
 7054:                            end
 7055:                    end},
 7056:          #{desc => "receive, with timeout",
 7057:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := Timeout}) ->
 7058:                            case Recv(Sock, Timeout) of
 7059:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7060:                                    ok;
 7061:                                {ok, _} ->
 7062:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7063:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7064:                                    ERROR
 7065:                            end
 7066:                    end},
 7067:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7068:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7069:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
 7070:                            ok
 7071:                    end},
 7072:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7073:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7074:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7075:                    end},
 7076:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7077:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 7078:                          sock     := Sock,
 7079:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7080:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 7081:                            State1 =
 7082:                                unlink_path(Path,
 7083:                                            fun() ->
 7084:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 7085:                                            end,
 7086:                                            fun() -> State end),
 7087:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7088:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7089:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7090:                                ok ->
 7091:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7092:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7093:                                    ERROR
 7094:                            end
 7095:                    end},
 7096:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7097:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7098:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7099:                            ok
 7100:                    end},
 7101: 
 7102:          %% Termination
 7103:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7104:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7105:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, terminate) of
 7106:                                ok ->
 7107:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7108:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7109:                                    ERROR
 7110:                            end
 7111:                    end},
 7112: 
 7113:          %% *** We are done ***
 7114:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7115:         ],
 7116: 
 7117:     SecServerSeq =
 7118:         [
 7119:          %% *** Init part ***
 7120:          #{desc => "await start",
 7121:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7122:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7123:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7124:                    end},
 7125:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7126:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7127:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7128:                            ok
 7129:                    end},
 7130:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7131:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7132:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 7133:                            ok
 7134:                    end},
 7135: 
 7136:          %% The actual test
 7137:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 7138:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7139:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 7140:                            
 7141:                    end},
 7142:          #{desc => "receive",
 7143:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 7144:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
 7145:                                {error, closed} ->
 7146:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7147:                                {ok, _} ->
 7148:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7149:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7150:                                    ERROR
 7151:                            end
 7152:                    end},
 7153:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 7154:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7155:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 7156:                            ok
 7157:                    end},
 7158: 
 7159:          %% Termination
 7160:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7161:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7162:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7163:                                ok ->
 7164:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7165:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7166:                                    ERROR
 7167:                            end
 7168:                    end},
 7169: 
 7170:          %% *** We are done ***
 7171:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7172:         ],
 7173: 
 7174: 
 7175:     TesterSeq =
 7176:         [
 7177:          %% *** Init part ***
 7178:          #{desc => "monitor primary server",
 7179:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7180:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7181:                            ok
 7182:                    end},
 7183:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 1",
 7184:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7185:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7186:                            ok
 7187:                    end},
 7188:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 2",
 7189:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7190:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7191:                            ok
 7192:                    end},
 7193:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 3",
 7194:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7195:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7196:                            ok
 7197:                    end},
 7198: 
 7199:          %% Start the primary server
 7200:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' start",
 7201:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7202:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7203:                            ok
 7204:                    end},
 7205:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (init)",
 7206:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7207:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, init),
 7208:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7209:                    end},
 7210: 
 7211:          %% Start the secondary server 1
 7212:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' start",
 7213:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7214:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7215:                            ok
 7216:                    end},
 7217:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (init)",
 7218:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7219:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, init)
 7220:                    end},
 7221: 
 7222:          %% Start the secondary server 2
 7223:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' start",
 7224:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7225:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7226:                            ok
 7227:                    end},
 7228:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (init)",
 7229:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7230:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, init)
 7231:                    end},
 7232: 
 7233:          %% Start the secondary server 3
 7234:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' start",
 7235:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7236:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7237:                            ok
 7238:                    end},
 7239:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (init)",
 7240:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7241:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, init)
 7242:                    end},
 7243: 
 7244: 
 7245:          %% The actual test
 7246:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7247:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7248:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7249:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7250:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7251: 
 7252:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to continue (recv)",
 7253:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7254:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7255:                            ok
 7256:                    end},
 7257:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7258:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to continue (recv)",
 7259:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7260:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7261:                            ok
 7262:                    end},
 7263:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7264:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to continue (recv)",
 7265:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7266:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7267:                            ok
 7268:                    end},
 7269:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7270:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (recv, with timeout)",
 7271:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7272:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv, ?SECS(5)),
 7273:                            ok
 7274:                    end},
 7275:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7276:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7277:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, recv)
 7278:                    end},
 7279:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (close)",
 7280:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7281:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7282:                            ok
 7283:                    end},
 7284:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (close)",
 7285:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7286:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, close)
 7287:                    end},
 7288:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (closed)",
 7289:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7290:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, recv_closed)
 7291:                    end},
 7292:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (closed)",
 7293:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7294:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, recv_closed)
 7295:                    end},
 7296:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (closed)",
 7297:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7298:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, recv_closed)
 7299:                    end},
 7300: 
 7301:          %% Terminations
 7302:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to terminate",
 7303:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7304:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7305:                            ok
 7306:                    end},
 7307:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' termination",
 7308:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7309:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7310:                                ok ->
 7311:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server3, State)};
 7312:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7313:                                    ERROR
 7314:                            end
 7315:                    end},
 7316:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to terminate",
 7317:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7318:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7319:                            ok
 7320:                    end},
 7321:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' termination",
 7322:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7323:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7324:                                ok ->
 7325:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server2, State)};
 7326:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7327:                                    ERROR
 7328:                            end
 7329:                    end},
 7330:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to terminate",
 7331:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7332:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7333:                            ok
 7334:                    end},
 7335:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' termination",
 7336:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7337:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7338:                                ok ->
 7339:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server1, State)};
 7340:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7341:                                    ERROR
 7342:                            end
 7343:                    end},
 7344:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to terminate",
 7345:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7346:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7347:                            ok
 7348:                    end},
 7349:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' termination",
 7350:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7351:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7352:                                ok ->
 7353:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_server, State)};
 7354:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7355:                                    ERROR
 7356:                            end
 7357:                    end},
 7358: 
 7359: 
 7360:          %% *** We are done ***
 7361:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7362:         ],
 7363:     
 7364: 
 7365:     i("start 'primary server' evaluator"),
 7366:     PrimSrvInitState = InitState,
 7367:     PrimServer = ?SEV_START("prim-server", PrimServerSeq, PrimSrvInitState),
 7368: 
 7369:     i("start 'secondary server 1' evaluator"),
 7370:     SecSrvInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 7371:     SecServer1 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-1", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7372: 
 7373:     i("start 'secondary server 2' evaluator"),
 7374:     SecServer2 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-2", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7375: 
 7376:     i("start 'secondary server 3' evaluator"),
 7377:     SecServer3 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-3", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7378: 
 7379:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7380:     TesterInitState = #{prim_server => PrimServer#ev.pid,
 7381:                         sec_server1 => SecServer1#ev.pid,
 7382:                         sec_server2 => SecServer2#ev.pid,
 7383:                         sec_server3 => SecServer3#ev.pid},
 7384:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7385: 
 7386:     i("await evaluator"),
 7387:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimServer, 
 7388:                             SecServer1, SecServer2, SecServer3,
 7389:                             Tester]).
 7390:

 7395: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 7396: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7397: 
 7398: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7399:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7400:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7401:            fun() ->
 7402:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
 7403:                    has_support_ipv4()
 7404:            end,
 7405:            fun() ->
 7406:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 7407:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7408:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7409:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7410:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7411:            end).
