 7551: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7552: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7553: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7554: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7555: %% git the setup anyway.
 7556: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7557: 
 7558: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7559:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7560:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
 7561:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7562:            fun() ->
 7563:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7564:                                  protocol => default},
 7565:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7566:            end).
 7567: 
 7568: 
 7569: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7570: 
 7571: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7572:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
 7573:         [
 7574:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7575:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 7576:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7577:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7578:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7579:                    end},
 7580:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7581:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7582:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7583:                            ok
 7584:                    end},
 7585: 
 7586:          %% *** Init part ***
 7587:          #{desc => "which local address",
 7588:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7589:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7590:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 7591:                    end},
 7592:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 7593:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 7594:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7595:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 7596:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7597:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 7598:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7599:                                    ERROR
 7600:                            end
 7601:                    end},
 7602:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 7603:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
 7604:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7605:                                ok ->
 7606:                                    ok;
 7607:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7608:                                    ERROR
 7609:                            end
 7610:                    end},
 7611:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 7612:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 7613:                            socket:listen(Sock)
 7614:                    end},
 7615:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7616:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7617:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7618:                            ok
 7619:                    end},
 7620: 
 7621:          %% The actual test
 7622:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7623:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7624:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 7625:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7626:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7627:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7628:                                    ERROR
 7629:                            end
 7630:                    end},
 7631:          #{desc => "await connection",
 7632:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
 7633:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
 7634:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7635:                                    ok;
 7636:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7637:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
 7638:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7639:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7640:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7641:                                    ERROR
 7642:                            end
 7643:                    end},
 7644:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
 7645:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7646:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
 7647:                            ok
 7648:                    end},
 7649:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7650:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7651:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7652:                    end},
 7653:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7654:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7655:                          sock   := Sock,
 7656:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7657:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7658:                                ok ->
 7659:                                    State1 =
 7660:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 7661:                                                    fun() ->
 7662:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 7663:                                                    end,
 7664:                                                    fun() ->
 7665:                                                            State
 7666:                                                    end),
 7667:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7668:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7669:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 7670:                                    ERROR
 7671:                            end;
 7672:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7673:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7674:                                ok ->
 7675:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7676:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7677:                                    ERROR
 7678:                            end
 7679:                    end},
 7680:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7681:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7682:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7683:                            ok
 7684:                    end},
 7685: 
 7686:                                                 % Termination
 7687:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 7688:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7689:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7690:                                ok ->
 7691:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7692:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7693:                                    ERROR
 7694:                            end
 7695:                    end},
 7696: 
 7697:          %% *** We are done ***
 7698:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7699:         ],
 7700: 
 7701:     SecAcceptorSeq =
 7702:         [
 7703:          %% *** Init part ***
 7704:          #{desc => "await start",
 7705:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7706:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7707:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7708:                    end},
 7709:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7710:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7711:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7712:                            ok
 7713:                    end},
 7714:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7715:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7716:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
 7717:                    end},
 7718: 
 7719:          %% The actual test
 7720:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7721:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7722:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 7723:                    end},
 7724:          #{desc => "accept",
 7725:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7726:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
 7727:                                {error, closed} ->
 7728:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7729:                                {ok, _} ->
 7730:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7731:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7732:                                    ERROR
 7733:                            end
 7734:                    end},
 7735:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
 7736:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7737:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
 7738:                    end},
 7739: 
 7740:          %% Termination
 7741:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7742:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7743:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7744:                                ok ->
 7745:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7746:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7747:                                    ERROR
 7748:                            end
 7749:                    end},
 7750: 
 7751:          %% *** We are done ***
 7752:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7753:         ],
 7754: 
 7755:     TesterSeq =
 7756:         [
 7757:          %% *** Init part ***
 7758:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
 7759:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7760:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7761:                            ok
 7762:                    end},
 7763:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
 7764:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7765:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7766:                            ok
 7767:                    end},
 7768:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
 7769:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7770:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7771:                            ok
 7772:                    end},
 7773:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
 7774:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7775:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7776:                            ok
 7777:                    end},
 7778: 
 7779:          %% Start the primary server
 7780:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
 7781:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7782:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7783:                            ok
 7784:                    end},
 7785:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
 7786:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7787:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
 7788:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7789:                    end},
 7790: 
 7791:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
 7792:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
 7793:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7794:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7795:                            ok
 7796:                    end},
 7797:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
 7798:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7799:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
 7800:                    end},
 7801: 
 7802:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
 7803:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
 7804:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7805:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7806:                            ok
 7807:                    end},
 7808:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
 7809:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7810:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
 7811:                    end},
 7812: 
 7813:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
 7814:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
 7815:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7816:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7817:                            ok
 7818:                    end},
 7819:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
 7820:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7821:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
 7822:                    end},
 7823: 
 7824: 
 7825:          %% The actual test
 7826:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7827:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7828:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7829:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7830:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7831: 
 7832:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
 7833:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7834:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7835:                            ok
 7836:                    end},
 7837:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7838:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
 7839:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7840:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7841:                            ok
 7842:                    end},
 7843:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7844:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
 7845:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7846:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7847:                            ok
 7848:                    end},
 7849:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7850:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
 7851:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7852:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
 7853:                            ok
 7854:                    end},
 7855:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
 7856:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7857:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
 7858:                    end},
 7859:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
 7860:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7861:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7862:                            ok
 7863:                    end},
 7864:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
 7865:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7866:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
 7867:                    end},
 7868:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
 7869:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7870:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
 7871:                    end},
 7872:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
 7873:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7874:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
 7875:                    end},
 7876:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
 7877:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7878:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
 7879:                    end},
 7880: 
 7881: 
 7882:          %% Terminations
 7883:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
 7884:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7885:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7886:                            ok
 7887:                    end},
 7888:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
 7889:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7890:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7891:                                ok ->
 7892:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
 7893:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7894:                                    ERROR
 7895:                            end
 7896:                    end},
 7897:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
 7898:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7899:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7900:                            ok
 7901:                    end},
 7902:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
 7903:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7904:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7905:                                ok ->
 7906:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
 7907:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7908:                                    ERROR
 7909:                            end
 7910:                    end},
 7911:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
 7912:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7913:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7914:                            ok
 7915:                    end},
 7916:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
 7917:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7918:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7919:                                ok ->
 7920:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
 7921:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7922:                                    ERROR
 7923:                            end
 7924:                    end},
 7925:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
 7926:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7927:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7928:                            ok
 7929:                    end},
 7930:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
 7931:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7932:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7933:                                ok ->
 7934:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
 7935:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7936:                                    ERROR
 7937:                            end
 7938:                    end},
 7939: 
 7940: 
 7941:          %% *** We are done ***
 7942:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7943:         ],
 7944: 
 7945: 
 7946:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
 7947:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
 7948:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
 7949: 
 7950:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
 7951:     SecAccInitState = #{},
 7952:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7953: 
 7954:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
 7955:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7956: 
 7957:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
 7958:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7959: 
 7960:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7961:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
 7962:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
 7963:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
 7964:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
 7965:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7966: 
 7967:     i("await evaluator"),
 7968:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
 7969: 
 7970: 
 7971: 
 7972: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7973: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7974: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7975: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7976: %%
 7977: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 7978: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 7979: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 7980: %%
 7981: 
 7982: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7983:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7984:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7985:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7986:            fun() ->
 7987:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7988:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7989:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7990:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7991:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7992:            end).
 7993: 
 7994: 
 7995: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7996: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7997: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7998: %% Socket is IPv6.
 7999: 
 8000: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8001:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8002:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8003:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 8004:            fun() ->
 8005:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8006:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 8007:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8008:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8009:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8010:            end).
 8011: 
 8012: 
 8013: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8014: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8015: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 8016: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 8017: 
 8018: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8019:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8020:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8021:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 8022:            fun() ->
 8023:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8024:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 8025:                                  protocol => default,
 8026:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8027:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8028:            end).
 8029: 
 8030: 
 8031: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8032: 
 8033: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 8034:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
 8035:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
 8036:     %% by the server!
 8037:     ServerSeq =
 8038:         [
 8039:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8040:          #{desc => "await start",
 8041:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8042:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8043:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 8044:                    end},
 8045:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8046:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8047:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8048:                            ok
 8049:                    end},
 8050: 
 8051:          %% *** Init part ***
 8052:          #{desc => "which local address",
 8053:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 8054:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8055:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 8056:                    end},
 8057:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 8058:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 8059:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8060:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8061:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 8062:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8063:                                    ERROR
 8064:                            end
 8065:                    end},
 8066:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 8067:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8068:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8069:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 8070:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8071:                                ok ->
 8072:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 8073:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8074:                                    ERROR
 8075:                            end;
 8076:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 8077:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 8078:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8079:                                ok ->
 8080:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 8081:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 8082:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8083:                                    ERROR
 8084:                            end
 8085:                    end},
 8086:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 8087:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8088:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 8089:                    end},
 8090:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8091:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 8092:                          tester   := Tester,
 8093:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 8094:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
 8095:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
 8096:                            %% as for non-local.
 8097:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 8098:                            ok;
 8099:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 8100:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 8101:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 8102:                            ok
 8103:                    end},
 8104: 
 8105:          %% The actual test
 8106:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
 8107:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8108:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 8109:                    end},
 8110:          #{desc => "accept 1",
 8111:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8112:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8113:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8114:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8115:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
 8116:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8117:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
 8118:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
 8119:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8120:                                    ERROR
 8121:                            end
 8122:                    end},
 8123:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 8124:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8125:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
 8126:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
 8127:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8128:                    end},
 8129:          #{desc => "accept 2",
 8130:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8131:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8132:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8133:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8134:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
 8135:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8136:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
 8137:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
 8138:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8139:                                    ERROR
 8140:                            end
 8141:                    end},
 8142:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 8143:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8144:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8145:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
 8146:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
 8147:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8148:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
 8149:                    end},
 8150:          #{desc => "accept 3",
 8151:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8152:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8153:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8154:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8155:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
 8156:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8157:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
 8158:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
 8159:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8160:                                    ERROR
 8161:                            end
 8162:                    end},
 8163:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 8164:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8165:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8166:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
 8167:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
 8168:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
 8169:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8170:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
 8171:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
 8172:                    end},
 8173:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
 8174:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8175:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 8176:                            ok
 8177:                    end},
 8178: 
 8179: 
 8180:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 8181:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8182:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 8183:                    end},
 8184:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
 8185:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8186:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8187:                            ok
 8188:                    end},
 8189:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
 8190:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8191:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8192:                            ok
 8193:                    end},
 8194:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
 8195:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8196:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8197:                            ok
 8198:                    end},
 8199:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
 8200:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8201:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8202:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8203:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8204:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
 8205:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8206:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
 8207:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8208:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8209:                                    Result;
 8210:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8211:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
 8212:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8213:                                    ERROR
 8214:                            end
 8215:                    end},
 8216:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
 8217:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8218:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8219:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8220:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8221:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
 8222:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8223:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8224:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8225:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8226:                                    Result;
 8227:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8228:                                    ERROR
 8229:                            end
 8230:                    end},
 8231:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
 8232:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8233:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8234:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8235:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8236:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
 8237:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8238:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8239:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
 8240:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8241:                                    Result;
 8242:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8243:                                    ERROR
 8244:                            end
 8245:                    end},
 8246:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
 8247:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8248:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 8249:                            ok
 8250:                    end},
 8251: 
 8252:          %% Termination
 8253:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8254:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 8255:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 8256:                                ok ->
 8257:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8258:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8259:                                    ERROR
 8260:                            end
 8261:                    end},
 8262:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 8263:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8264:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
 8265:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8266:                            ok
 8267:                    end},
 8268:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 8269:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8270:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8271:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
 8272:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
 8273:                            {ok, State2}
 8274:                    end},
 8275:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 8276:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8277:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8278:                            ok
 8279:                    end},
 8280:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 8281:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8282:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8283:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
 8284:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
 8285:                            {ok, State2}
 8286:                    end},
 8287:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 8288:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8289:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8290:                            ok
 8291:                    end},
 8292:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 8293:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8294:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8295:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
 8296:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
 8297:                            {ok, State2}
 8298:                    end},
 8299:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 8300:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8301:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8302:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 8303:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8304:                                ok ->
 8305:                                    State1 =
 8306:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 8307:                                                    fun() ->
 8308:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 8309:                                                    end,
 8310:                                                    fun() ->
 8311:                                                            State
 8312:                                                    end),
 8313:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 8314:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8315:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 8316:                                    ERROR
 8317:                            end;
 8318:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 8319:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8320:                                ok ->
 8321:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 8322:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8323:                                    ERROR
 8324:                            end
 8325:                    end},
 8326: 
 8327:          %% *** We are done ***
 8328:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8329:         ],
 8330: 
 8331:     ClientSeq =
 8332:         [
 8333:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8334:          #{desc => "await start",
 8335:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8336:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8337:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 8338:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
 8339:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8340:                    end},
 8341:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8342:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8343:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8344:                            ok
 8345:                    end},
 8346: 
 8347:          %% *** Init part ***
 8348:          #{desc => "create node",
 8349:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
 8350:                            {Peer, Node} =
 8351:                                start_node(?CT_PEER_NAME(?F("client_~w",
 8352:                                                            [NodeID]))),
 8353:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
 8354:                    end},
 8355:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
 8356:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 8357:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 8358:                            ok
 8359:                    end},
 8360:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 8361:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 8362:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
 8363:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 8364:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 8365:                    end},
 8366:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 8367:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 8368:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8369:                            ok
 8370:                    end},
 8371:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 8372:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 8373:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 8374:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
 8375:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 8376:                            ok
 8377:                    end},
 8378:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 8379:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8380:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8381:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 8382:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8383:                    end},
 8384:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8385:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8386:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 8387:                            ok
 8388:                    end},
 8389: 
 8390:          %% The actual test
 8391:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 8392:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8393:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8394:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 8395:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8396:                            ok
 8397:                    end},
 8398:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 8399:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8400:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 8401:                            ok
 8402:                    end},
 8403:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 8404:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8405:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8406:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
 8407:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8408:                    end},
 8409:          #{desc => "announce ready (connected)",
 8410:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8411:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 8412:                            ok
 8413:                    end},
 8414:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 8415:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8416:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8417:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
 8418:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8419:                            ok
 8420:                    end},
 8421:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
 8422:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8423:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 8424:                            ok
 8425:                    end},
 8426:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 8427:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8428:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8429:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close, 
 8430:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8431:                    end},
 8432:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 8433:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8434:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 8435:                            ok
 8436:                    end},
 8437: 
 8438:          %% Termination
 8439:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8440:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 8441:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 8442:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 8443:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 8444:                                ok ->
 8445:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8446:                                {error,
 8447:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
 8448:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
 8449:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
 8450:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
 8451:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
 8452:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8453:                                    ERROR
 8454:                            end
 8455:                    end},
 8456:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 8457:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
 8458:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
 8459:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
 8460:                            ok
 8461:                    end},
 8462:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 8463:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 8464:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 8465:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
 8466:                                        [RClient]),
 8467:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 8468:                            {ok, State1}
 8469:                    end},
 8470:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 8471:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 8472:                            {ok,
 8473:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 8474:                                 ok ->
 8475:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 8476:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 8477:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8478:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8479:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8480:                             catch
 8481:                                 C:E:S ->
 8482:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8483:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 8484:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 8485:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 8486:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8487:                             end}
 8488:                    end},
 8489:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 8490:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 8491:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
 8492:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
 8493:                            receive
 8494:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 8495:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 8496:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8497:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8498:                                    {ok, State2}
 8499:                            end;
 8500:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 8501:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 8502:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8503:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8504:                            {ok, State2}
 8505:                    end},
 8506: 
 8507:          %% *** We are done ***
 8508:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8509:         ],
 8510:

 8731:                    end},

 8739:                                    ERROR
 8740:                            end
 8741:                    end},

 8755:                            end

 8760:                            ok
 8761:                    end},

 8763:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8764:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8765:                                ok ->
 8766:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 8767:                                    {ok, State1};
 8768:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8769:                                    ERROR
 8770:                            end
 8771:                    end},
 8772: 
 8773:          %% *** We are done ***
 8774:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8775:         ],
 8776: 
 8777:     i("start server evaluator"),
 8778:     ServerInitState = InitState,
 8779:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 8780: 
 8781:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 8782:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 8783:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8784:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8785:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8786: 
 8787:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 8788:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
 8789:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 8790:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 8791:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
 8792:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 8793: 
 8794:     i("await evaluator"),
 8795:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
 8796:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
 8797:                             Tester]).
 8798: 
 8799: 
 8800: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
 8801:     Self = self(),
 8802:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
 8803:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 8804: 
 8805: 
 8806: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
 8807:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 8808:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 8809:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 8810:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 8811:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 8812:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 8813:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 8814:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 8815:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 8816:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 8817:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 8818:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 8819:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 8820:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 8821:     exit(Reason).
 8822: 
 8823: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 8824:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 8825:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 8826:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8827:     ok.
 8828: 
 8829: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 8830:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 8831:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 8832: 
 8833: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 8834:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 8835:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8836:         {ok, Sock} ->
 8837:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
 8838:                 {ok, FD} ->
 8839:                     put(sname, ?F("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
 8840:                 _ ->
 8841:                     ok
 8842:             end,
 8843:             Sock;
 8844:         {error, Reason} ->
 8845:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 8846:     end.
 8847: 
 8848: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 8849:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 8850:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8851:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 8852:         ok ->
 8853:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 8854:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 8855:                     Path;
 8856:                 {ok, _} ->
 8857:                     undefined;
 8858:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 8859:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 8860:             end;
 8861:         {error, Reason} ->
 8862:             exit({bind, Reason})
 8863:     end.
 8864: 
 8865: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8866:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
 8867:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 8868: 
 8869: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8870:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
 8871:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8872: 
 8873: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 8874:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 8875:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 8876:         ok ->
 8877:             ok;
 8878:         {error, Reason} ->
 8879:             exit({connect, Reason})
 8880:     end.
 8881: 
 8882: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 8883:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 8884:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 8885:         ok ->
 8886:             unlink_path(Path),
 8887:             ok;
 8888:         {error, Reason} ->
 8889:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 8890:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 8891:             unlink_path(Path),
 8892:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 8893:     end.
 8894: 
 8895: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 8896:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 8897:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 8898:         ok ->
 8899:             ok;
 8900:         {error, Reason} ->
 8901:             Reason
 8902:     end.
 8903: 
 8904: 
 8905: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 8906: 
 8907: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
 8908:     Self     = self(),
 8909:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 8910:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 8911:     Pid.
 8912: 
 8913: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 8914:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
 8915:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 8916:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
 8917:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
 8918:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 8919:     exit(Reason).
 8920: 
 8921: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
 8922:     put(sname, ?F("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
 8923:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8924:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 8925:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 8926:     ok.
 8927: 
 8928: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 8929:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 8930:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 8931: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8932:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 8933:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8934: 
 8935: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
 8936:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 8937:     try Recv(Sock) of
 8938:         {error, closed} ->
 8939:             ok;
 8940:         {ok, Data} ->
 8941:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
 8942:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
 8943:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
 8944:             {error, unexpected_success};
 8945:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8946:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 8947:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8948:             ERROR
 8949:     catch
 8950:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
 8951:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
 8952:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
 8953:             exit({skip, Error});
 8954:         C:E:S ->
 8955:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 8956:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 8957:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 8958:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 8959:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 8960:     end.
 8961: 
 8962: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 8963:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 8964:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 8965:     ok.
 8966: 
 8967: 
 8968: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8969: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8970: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8971: %% Socket is IPv4.
 8972: 
 8973: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8974:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8975:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
 8976:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 8977:            fun() ->
 8978:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8979:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 8980:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8981:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8982:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8983:            end).
 8984:

 8996:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,

 9006: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.

 9014:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,

 9018:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 9019:            end).
